epd_owner.name: Holcim (Australia) Pty Ltd
epd_owner.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_produced_by.name: Edge Environment Pty Ltd
epd_produced_by.address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

epd_process_certified_by.name: Epsten Group
epd_process_certified_by.address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.general_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for foundations, driveways, footpaths, slabs, and other construction applications.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, with high strength, durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural finishes.

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
manual_calculated_impact_categories: Use of renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials
Use of non-renewable primary energy excluding non-renewable primary energy resources used as raw materials

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good across all states
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

upstream: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials
Generation of electricity from primary and secondary energy resources
core: External transportation of materials to core processes
Manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck)
Treatment of waste and wastewater from manufacturing
downstream: Transport and treatment of waste at end of life

lca_information.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

assumptions.deconstruction_process: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) not included in EPD results; recommended to consider in whole-of-life studies per BS EN 16757:2017

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Waste concrete processed into recycled aggregate replacing virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR 2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Man Yu et al., The Carbon Footprint of Australia's Construction Sector, Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks.
Certain impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience.
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects.

contact_information.address: Level 40/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

additional_info.notes: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change; users should confirm current issue with Holcim Customer Service. This publication is general information only and not a substitute for professional technical engineering advice.
